articles.author: Erin Heffernan
articles.title: 1st St. Louis County female officer reflects on days gone by
articles.description: ST. LOUIS (AP) — When Winona “Jean” Schrieber became the first female St. Louis County police officer in 1957, her uniform had a brown skirt and high heels but no place to put her gun. So she kept it in her purse. The St. Louis Post-Dispatch reports that Schr…

articles.description: Times were very different when Winona “Jean” Schrieber joined the force in 1957.

Fight Club: Dark secrets of Florida juvenile justice
articles.description: By Carol Marbin Miller and Audra D.S. Burch, Miami Herald The boys had just returned to Module 9 of the Miami juvenile lockup from the dining hall when one of them hit Elord Revolte high and hard. More of the boys jumped in, punching and slamming him over and…

articles.author: By Carol Marbin Miller and Audra D.S. Burch cmarbin@MiamiHerald.com
articles.title: Dark secrets of Florida juvenile justice: ‘honey-bun hits,’ illicit sex, cover-ups
articles.description: Elord Revolte, 17, was beaten to death by a mob of teenage detainees at the Miami-Dade juvenile lockup. Cameras recorded the attack. Two youths said the mauling was ordered by staff. Charges filed: None. A look at Florida’s juvenile justice system.
